operator.title: Edge Processing
operator.synopsis: Edge Processing operator enables user to create a workflow that can be deployed to the connected RTS agent for execution. The operator follows the steps below: 1. Packages the nested workflow into a zip file 2. Uploads the zip file to the connected AI Hub 3. Via AI Hub, the workflow is sent to the connected RTS agent for execution

text.paragraph: Edge Processing operator enables user to create a workflow that can be deployed to the connected RTS agent for execution. The operator follows the steps below: 1. Packages the nested workflow into a zip file 2. Uploads the zip file to the connected AI Hub 3. Via AI Hub, the workflow is sent to the connected RTS agent for execution

port.name: connection
port.paragraph: The connection to the ai hub, where the nested workflow is uploaded for deployment.

port.name: connection
port.paragraph: The connection to the available rts agent, where the nested workflow is sent for execution.

port.name: output
port.paragraph: This is port is a port extender, which means if a port is connected a new output port is created. Any IOObject can be connected to the inner port and is passed to the corresponding outer port.

parameter.paragraph: The internal name of the project to create on AI Hub.
The human-readable display name of the project.
If true, the deployed workflow runs continuously on RTSA.
Sleep interval (in milliseconds) between continuous execution cycles.
Advanced permission settings for the new project. Each entry contains a group name and the privilege ("ACCESS" or "OWNERSHIP").
Repository folder whose contents will be added to the new project before deployment.
If true, initializes the project directory structure when creating the project.
If true, enables Git LFS support for the project on AI Hub.
If true, the operator stops with an error if project creation fails.
Optional secret string used during project creation and deployment.
